HW4

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • HW4.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    View

    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Frame class for the graphical user interface of connect five. View for showing the state of the model.
    Author:
    Edgar Padilla, Oscar Galindo, Mario Delgado:
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI(Board board,
           BoardPanel panel)
        Constructor that initializes and adds all the components of the frame including anonymous classes for the handlers.
        Parameters:
        Board - board (receives the model representation of the game).
        BoardPanel - panel (receives the instance of the panel that will draw the board).

        Parameters:

      • addListener

        public void addListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener e)
        This method initializes the common ActionListener on all elements(buttons/JMenuItems) of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        ActionListener - e the action listener to be impleted on each option of the Menu and Toolbar.

        public void playEffect(int state)

        Parameters:

        public void setBoard(Board newBoard)
        Sets the board that will be used as a model throught the view components of the MVC architecture, displays the size of the board in the status panel,
        Parameters:
        Board - newBoard (represents the new board that selected by the user).

        public void setBoardListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener e)
        Sets the listener of the board and allows felixibilty in execution.
        Parameters:
        MouseListener - e (instance that will listen the mouse in the board).

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(java.lang.String input)
        Sets the status panel to what the desires status message is.
        Parameters:

      • setPlaying

        public void setPlaying(boolean input)
        Sets the playing status on or off to prevent features to be used from GUI class.
        Parameters:
        boolean - input indicates whether the game is being played or not.
